- - - EXAMINATION
Good afternoon, Ms. Thomas.  My name is Devon Sereda.  I represent the defendant in this matter. Have you ever had your deposition taken before?
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Yes, I have.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You're familiar with the process, but I'm just going to go over some rules because I'm guessing that deposition was not yesterday.
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: We have a court reporter that's sitting between us.  Everything that you and I say is being taken down by her.  For that reason, it's important that all your responses be verbal.  It's easy in everyday conversation to nod, shrug your shoulders, say uh-uh or uh-huh, but that won't make a clear record.  If you do that, I'm going to give you a quick reminder we need a verbal response, okay?
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It's also easy in everyday conversation to anticipate where my next question is going and start to talk before I finish my question, but that makes her job harder.  Try to make sure I finish my question before you start your answer.  If for any reason I cut off your answer and started my next question, let me know so we can get your full answer on the record.
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm sure your attorney has advised you of this, but we don't want you to guess at any answers today.  If you don't know the answer to my question or you don't remember the answer to my question, those are perfectly acceptable responses as long as they are the truth, okay?
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: There may be questions that I ask you to estimate time or distance.  Once again, we don't want you to guess.  But if you feel like you're able to make an estimate, go ahead and do so.  Just let me know that you're making an estimate, okay?
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: All right, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I don't typically take very long with depositions, but if at any point you need to take a break, use the restroom, speak with your attorney, whatever it may be, I'd be happy to give you that time.  I just ask, if there is a question pending, we take that break after the question is answered, okay?
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If I ask a question that you don't understand, please let me know.  Because if you answer it, I'm going to assume you understood it.  If any part of my question seems unclear, let me know.  I'll be happy to rephrase it so that it is clear, okay?
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Okay, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have any questions about those instructions?

text: No, I do not.

text: Describe for me what happened.
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Well, the car was parked.  I was siting in the passenger seat.  I was on my Kindle.  I was reading a book on my Kindle, just sitting there relaxing. All of a sudden I heard tires and then this bang, this really hard bang.  I went flying forward, and my Kindle came out of my hands and hit the dashboard.  I hit the dash. Then for a second time the same thing happened again, not even 30 seconds the exact same thing happened again before I could even adjust myself.  I went forward and hit the front.  Now, I'm still jostled, so I hit the side, the right side, on second impact.  My Kindle cracked.  I also have it with me, too.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You hit the dashboard again. What body part struck the dashboard?
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: I hit my chest, and the Kindle hit the dashboard, also.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Then you said you hit the right side?
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Yes.  On second impact, I hit the right door panel, like the door panel went right into my side and my hip.

text: You said your Kindle got a crack in it?
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Yes, I have it.  It's totally broken.

speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Sure.  I also brought my receipt because it was actually only a few month's old.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You said there was less than 30 seconds between the two impacts?
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What happened after the second impact?
speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: I was pretty much so shocked and startled.  I opened the car door.  When I opened the car door, the lights came on in the car.  The driver, by that time, his car was fully parked. He saw me get out, and he started yelling at me because I guess he didn't realize there was someone in the car because it was dark.  When I opened the door, the lights came on. I got out.  I kept saying, sir, sir, sir.  He started yelling at me, using profanity.  He was yelling in Spanish, which I presume it was profanity because it was not very nice. At that point, I got back in the car because I was really upset and in pain.  I called my boyfriend, which he was around the corner at the barbershop.  That's the reason why I was sitting in the car.  He was in the barbershop getting a haircut. I called him and told him what happened.  He came and the gentleman continued to -- he got more irate and started yelling.  He was also intoxicated.

speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: No.

text: Let's talk about how you're currently feeling.  I don't mean as you're sitting in the chair across from me today, but let's say over the last 90 days. Are you still getting back pain?

text: It increases with different activities.  It's mild on sitting, but if I'm doing activities, something like housework, it starts to flare up.

text: About a 7.

speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Yes.

speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: No.

text: Maybe twice, yes.

text: That varies, also.  It can be anywhere from maybe a 4 to an 8 depending on what I'm doing.

speaker: MS. SEREDA

text: Yes.

text: If I walk two blocks or so, it starts hurting.

text: What's the pain level like in your right thigh?

text: About a 6.

text: A couple days, yes.

text: What's the pain level like in your right hip?

Then I want to talk about any activities that you still do, but you might do them with some sort of pain or limitation less frequently.

text: Okay.

Actually, it's in their notes, LA Fitness, because I was continuing to pay them every single month for the last two years.  I finally wised up and stopped paying them because it was put on hold ever since that.

I don't make a practice of going up and down the steps.  I kind of settle in place either upstairs or downstairs.
